intro: Koanophyllon iteophyllum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Koanophyllon iteophyllum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
